common_issues.title: Pieces Assistant Vague Response
common_issues.description: Users report the Pieces Assistant responding with vague promises of future solutions instead of actionable responses. This occurs after multiple interactions (15+ files, 22+ requests).  Workarounds are unclear, but restarting PiecesOS or trying again later may help. The Pieces team is investigating the issue.

related_issues.title: Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
related_issues.text:
Response "I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible"
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**The Bug**
The chat assistant will respond claiming that it's working on a solution and will get back to you at a later date. 

**Expected Behaviour**
Get an actionable response with some suggested action/code.

**Details**
Most recent example of this kind of response ("_" is not part of the response just a redaction):

> "I'll carefully examine the data flow related to _, _, _, _, and _  to see if any inconsistencies could lead to bugs. Please give me a few minutes to review the code thoroughly with this specific focus in mind. I'll get back to you with my findings as soon as possible."

This has happened in three different conversations. I first noticed the behaviour this month, so not before updates preceding March. I promise I'm not trying to be lazy on this one, it's difficult to offer reproduction steps.

I use Claude 3.5 more than any option regularly.

The last conversation where this happened:

- I loaded 15 files into the context menu
- I sent 22 requests (and received 22 responses where it happened on the 22nd response)

I'll update this issue if there's anything I can do to make the reproduction more narrow.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User @seantiz created an issue that requires attention.
* Issue automatically routed to the appropriate Pieces team member.
* User might find similar issue #652 helpful.

**Problems identified:**

* The details of the user's issue are not explicitly stated in the conversation excerpt.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Pieces support bot provided resources and indicated a follow-up within 24 hours.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue is acknowledged and being reviewed by the Pieces team. The user can expect a follow-up soon. 

**Additional notes:**

* More information is needed about the user's specific issue to fully understand the context and potential solutions.

related_issues.title: "Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
related_issues.text:
"Secret Message" Example doesn't work properly
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When using LTM-2 to test the secret message example:
https://pieces.app/magic-moments/ltm

I got a strange response from the LLM:
Claude 3.5:
First Try:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1962a3e4-8b02-4d3f-bc8c-4bdd72c80aa6)
2. try: (waited longer on the website)
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cd71c5c1-d5d5-4449-acd5-e070fb244fa9)

Gemini 2.0 Flash did fail completely:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/50735f7a-28a1-4563-b490-e10c271eca23)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key points raised:**

* The issue is triggered by a bug that wrongly flags some devices supporting vector search as incompatible.
* This results in PiecesOS running in "basic mode" with limited functionality.
* Symptoms include:
    * "Workstream Activity" tab missing
    * No LTM engine updates
    * Possible display of "basic mode due to device constraints"

**Problems identified:**

* Inaccurate device classification prevents users from accessing desired features.
* Users face confusion due to limited information about "basic mode."

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Restarting PiecesOS temporarily resolves the issue.
* A fix for the underlying bug is planned for the next PiecesOS version.
* Developer clarifies the meaning of "basic mode."

**Current status/outcome:**

* Restarting PiecesOS is the current workaround.
* The bug fix is in progress for a future release.
* Further explanation of "basic mode" is provided.

**Additional notes:**

* The "unknown origin" element might be related to a previous installation.

related_issues.title: Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again
related_issues.text:
Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

Pieces for Developers 4.0.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When copy paste code sencond time in Ask anything give error  this message is empty please try again
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation 

**Key points raised:**

* Users @amarranjan1, @veerendranath0312, and @govard108 reported an error message in the Pieces desktop app ("Pieces desktop this message is empty please try again show error"). 
* The error occurred after updating the app and prevented sending messages beyond the first one.

**Problems identified:**

* The Pieces desktop app displayed an error message preventing users from sending additional messages after the initial one. 
* This issue affected users on Mac and Windows.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The Pieces Support Bot provided related issues and resources.
* Mackenzie, from the Pieces team, acknowledged the issue and announced a patch release to resolve it.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue was resolved with a patch release on March 12, 2025.

**Additional notes:**

* User @govard108 confirmed the problem was solved after the update. 
* The conversation demonstrates efficient user communication and timely issue resolution by the Pieces team.

## Summary in 3 points:

1. Users reported a message sending error in the Pieces desktop app.
2. The Pieces team acknowledged the issue and released a patch to fix it.
3. The problem was successfully resolved.

common_issues.title: Pieces extension conflicts causing UI issues
common_issues.description: Pieces extensions for Visual Studio and web browsers are causing conflicts, leading to unexpected behavior like uneditable fields in SQL Server Object Explorer and malfunctioning embed buttons. Solutions include disabling the extension, restarting the application, or waiting for a patch fix from the Pieces team. Issues are often resolved through updates and bug fixes.

related_issues.title: Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
related_issues.text:
Pieces Visual Studio 2022 extension conflict with SQL Server Object Explorer
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Visual Studio

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

With Pieces Extension installed in Visual studio 2022, SQL database field is not editable (not clickable?)

Reproduce: 
- Connect to any SQL server with some table, choose a table and right click -> View Data
- Try edit the database's table field (the field will be unable to focus, so unable to edit)

* SQL database is editable again after disable pieces extension and restart VS.
* Try turn off everything in the extension's UserPreference did not work.
* While you can not edit a field, but delete a row is possible (so maybe some UI conflict?)

Here are some picture

Without the extension: the edit cursor shown up when click on field
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c45dbafe-29c7-4acd-9827-b34cd0cd76f7)

With the extension: the edit cursor did not show up. Clicking just selected the field.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8f430ff6-18f8-41fe-a58e-42ebbeec3be2)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key points raised:**

* User (@hikineet98) reported an issue where the cursor disappears after editing a cell in a script file.

**Problems identified:**

* The cursor cannot be returned after being removed from the cell.
* The cause of the issue is unknown, but a conflict with the Pieces for Visual Studio plugin is suspected.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* The issue has been replicated by the development team.
* Further investigation is ongoing to identify the root cause and potential solutions.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue remains unresolved. 
* The development team is actively investigating the problem.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension messing out stackoverflow
related_issues.text:
Chrome Extension messing out stackoverflow
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Web Extension

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

It fills this text endlessly...

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6b5edb10-b7cf-4fa6-a523-aa73af94cbee)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points Raised:**

* luceat-lux-vestra reported an issue where embed buttons were not working on a specific page.

**Problems Identified:**

* The embed buttons were not appearing on the page, even though they were enabled in the extension.
* This issue was previously fixed by blacklisting the page, but it seems to have resurfaced.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* rutvik-at-pieces requested information about the PWE version and whether embed buttons were enabled.
* luceat-lux-vestra confirmed that they were using PWE version 4.0.4 and that embed buttons were enabled.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue is still being investigated. No solution has been implemented yet.

**Additional Notes:**

* The issue seems to be specific to the page in question.
* It is possible that the page is still blacklisted, even though it shouldn't be.


**Overall, the issue is still open and unresolved. More information is needed to determine the cause of the problem and implement a solution.**

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Update and Installation Issues
common_issues.description: Users report difficulties with Pieces OS updates and installations. Problems include update failures, conflicts with personal domain settings, and lack of installation path control. Proposed solutions involve checking for existing issues, updating App Installer, configuring antivirus software, and contacting Pieces support.

related_issues.title: Personal Domain backup
related_issues.text:
Personal Domain backup
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [x] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I want to sync this PC to another PC，but i cann't backup the lastest data.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/bfb4fb14-5e7f-45c7-828f-5f77f550453a)

this is another PC

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/3c2d880e-a1b2-40c1-82b1-9935bffbf8fb)
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Key Points:**

* User (@laborer123) reported two issues:
    * Difficulty changing personal domain after copying files to another PC.
    * Inability to back up current computer due to outdated backup.
* User later clarified their goal: backing up current computer using Personal Domain and restoring to a new computer.

**Problems Identified:**

* Personal domain registration conflict on new PC.
* Current computer backup outdated.
* User confusion about Personal Domain functionality.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* **Personal Domain:**
    * Mark-at-pieces suggested user attempt registering a new domain.
* **Backup/Restore:**
    * Mark-at-pieces explained the restore process and emphasized its data-overwriting nature.
    * User clarified their desire to back up the current computer and restore to a new one.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* User provided additional information and requested assistance with backing up their current computer using Personal Domain.
* Issue remained open, awaiting further response/solution.

**Additional Notes:**

* Screenshots provided by user and support specialist were attached to the issue.

related_issues.title: Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
related_issues.text:
Installation doesn't follow the System Apps default location
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.2

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

There's no opportunity for the User to choose where the Pieces OS is installed or where any data that's collected is stored. From Windows 10 onwards there is a system feature to set where new content is to be stored by default. This is in Settings/System/Storage.

You can set where new Apps will be installed, new documents are stored, Music, etc.

Once this is set I would expect a current application to follow the default installation setting rather than hardcode it for the Boot drive.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User @bpluly created an issue regarding Pieces OS update failing.
* The issue was automatically routed to the proper Pieces team member for follow-up within 24 hours.

**Problems identified:**

* User is unable to update Pieces OS.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Automatic routing of the issue to the responsible team member.
* Providing helpful resources such as related issues, documentation, and YouTube channel.

**Current status/outcome:**

* It is currently unclear whether the user's issue has been resolved.

**Additional notes:**

* This conversation is from March 13, 2025.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Update fails
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Update fails
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

The notification popped up saying an update was available so I clicked Update and a few seconds later got this message box:

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b14dc8ab-632a-4095-b45b-7bbaba3c70ce)

This is on a very fresh Windows 11 installation.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User "@ThatRendle" reported an issue with PiecesOS not launching on Windows.
* Bot identified similar issues and suggested relevant resources.
* Pieces staff member, "@nathan-courtney-pieces", suggested updating App Installer and provided troubleshooting steps.
* Another user, "@bejokun", reported the same issue with Kaspersky antivirus detecting PiecesOS as a trojan.

**Problems Identified:**

* PiecesOS not launching on Windows.
* Antivirus software (Kaspersky) blocking PiecesOS.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Update App Installer on Windows.
* Configure Kaspersky to allow PiecesOS processes.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Unclear if the original user's issue was resolved.
* Second user needs to configure Kaspersky to allow PiecesOS.

**Additional Notes:**

* The conversation suggests this issue might be related to Windows App Installer and antivirus software. 
* More information is needed to determine the root cause and effectiveness of the proposed solutions.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Installation and Update Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS installation not adhering to custom system app locations and update failures. Proposed solutions include checking system storage settings and ensuring compatibility with antivirus software like Kaspersky. Issues seem to involve Windows App Installer and require further investigation by the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus
related_issues.text:
Kaspersky Internet Security flags Pieces OS as a virus
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS_11.2.2.0_x64

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/160ed12d-f0a1-46be-bf36-05502353405e)
## GitHub issue conversation summary:

**Key points raised:**

* User (@uwascan) created an issue, automatically triaged by Pieces support bot.

**Problem identified:**

* Information not specified in the conversation snippet.

**Proposed/implemented solutions:**

* Support bot provided helpful related issues and resources for potential troubleshooting.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The issue has been routed to the proper Pieces team member for further investigation. A follow-up is expected within 24 hours.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces Assistant's vague responses:** This issue has a high frequency and directly impacts user experience. Investigate the root cause and provide clearer workarounds or solutions.

**Address Pieces extension conflicts:** Conflicts with Visual Studio and web browsers are causing significant usability issues. Dedicate resources to resolve these conflicts and improve extension compatibility.

**Investigate and resolve Pieces OS installation and update issues:** Users are facing difficulties with updates, installation paths, and antivirus conflicts. Thoroughly test update mechanisms and provide clear instructions for installation and antivirus configuration.
**Improve communication around 'basic mode':** Users are confused about 'basic mode' limitations. Provide clear documentation explaining its functionality and limitations.

**Consider a more robust backup and restore process for Personal Domain:** Users are encountering difficulties with backing up and restoring data. Simplify the process and provide clearer instructions to avoid data loss concerns.

**Monitor and address issues related to specific antivirus software:** Kaspersky is flagging Pieces OS as a virus. Collaborate with antivirus vendors to whitelist Pieces OS and prevent false positives.
**Continue monitoring ticket activity levels:** Track the activity levels of tickets to identify and prioritize emerging issues or trends.
